pullRequest.body:
Definition of the modular character map, and proof that it is a homomorphism.

---

nodes.body:
I have some doubts about this PR which I hope you can help in resolving: 
- How to define (and name) properly the function form of this, before the proof of it being a homomorphism. 
- Whether to add a version of the map that does not depend on the given Haar measure.
- A technical problem - `to_additive` fails on `modularCharacter`. I am not sure what to do with this.

Thanks!

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10383~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#10401~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

@atarnoam What's the current status with the PR? 

Github doesn't always present the history in the correct order, so I'm not sure about this; but it looks like the PR didn't actually change at all between Sebastien tagging it as "awaiting author", and you removing his tag and setting it back to "awaiting review". Is it possible that you made changes to the code in a local branch on your machine, but forgot to push them to github, or something like that?
@atarnoam Are you planning to continue working on this PR? If not, please feel free to close it, or label it with `please-adopt`.

@atarnoam, it looks like the PR hasn't moved since we last pinged you. We're going to close this for now, just for the sake of cleaning up our [PR queue](https://bit.ly/3Ymuh0U). But please do feel free to either re-open the PR if you'd like to continue working on it, or come across to the [PR reviews](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/) zulip stream to ask for advice or request that we look at this again.
Hi, sorry for the long delay... I reopened the PR and would appreciate it being reviewed!

### PR summary [16dd2bcf39](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10436/commits/16dd2bcf39d6b29070769bf720d2eb36deb80c5e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Group.ModularCharacter` (new file)|2034|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ map_right_mul_eq_modularCharacterFun_smul`
`+ modularCharacter`
`+ modularCharacterFun`
`+ modularCharacterFun_eq_haarScalarFactor`
`+ modularCharacter_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← isMulLeftInvariant_eq_smul_of_innerRegular] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion _ = modularCharacter_fun μ g • μ' := by rw [← isMulLeftInvariant_eq_smul_of_innerRegular] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion _ = modularCharacter_fun μ g • μ' := by rw [← isMulLeftInvariant_eq_smul_of_innerRegular] ```
Is this right?
Nope :)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion comp_mul_right, ← haarScalarFactor_eq_mul] ```

```suggestion
* `modularCharacter_fun`: Given a measure μ, define the modular character associated with this
  measure, using the (noncomputable) `haarScalarFactor`. The result that this does not depend on the
  measure chosen (as long as it is inner regular) is `modularCharacter_fun_eq`.
* `modularCharacter`: The homomorphism G →* ℝ≥0 whose toFun is `modularCharacter_fun`.
```

I wonder if it would be better to remove the dependence on `μ` by defining the map using the arbitrary choice provided by `MeasureTheory.Measure.haar`, and then show that `map_right_mul_eq_modularCharacter_smul` holds for any Haar measure `μ`. But I'm not sure how well this would work in the situation when `G` isn't second-countable and the uniqueness results are weaker – if the answer is "it's a horrible mess" then feel free to ignore my remark!
I'm not sure. @sgouezel, I know you've done work on uniqueness of Haar measures, what do you think?
I think this quantity should not depend on mu, so indeed one should probably remove mu from the definition, use an arbitrary choice of Haar measure, and then prove that it works for any Haar measure.
So should all of this be under the assumption that G is second countable?

No, I don't think so, a locally compact group should be enough. A lemma like integral_isMulLeftInvariant_eq_smul_of_hasCompactSupport or haarScalarFactor_eq_integral_div should be enough to characterize everything, if I'm not mistaken.
Done :) @sgouezel @loefflerd

```suggestion
/-- The modular character homomorphism. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The modular character does not depend on the choice of the Haar measure. -/
@[to_additive addModularCharacter_eq "The additive modular character does not depend on the choice
of the additive Haar measure."]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive addModularCharacterFun "Definition of the addModularCharacter map"]
noncomputable def modularCharacterFun (μ : Measure G) [IsHaarMeasure μ] : G → ℝ≥0 :=
  fun g => haarScalarFactor (map (· * g) μ) μ
```
Please refer to [the naming convention](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/wiki/Lean-4-survival-guide-for-Lean-3-users#naming-conventions).
I couldn't add `to_additive` here because I think he tries to turn the multiplication on RR to addition too? I would appreciate help with this.
You should never do this globally: only do `open scoped Classical in` before definitions or lemmas that need it in the statement (if it's just for a proof, start the proof with `classical` instead)
This does not correspond to the content of the file any more.
Could you instead explain in the docstring what this function is, i.e., what the modular character is. And also mention that you will define `modularCharacter` as a homomorphism below?

You shouldn't assume that `G` is a Borel measurable space for the definition: the definition makes sense if `G` is a locally compact group, and you should endow `G` with its Borel structure inside the definition.
Could you explain how to do this?

Something like
```
noncomputable def modularCharacterFun (g : G) : ℝ≥0 :=
  letI : MeasurableSpace G := borel G
  haveI : BorelSpace G := ⟨rfl⟩
  haarScalarFactor (map (· * g) MeasureTheory.Measure.haar) MeasureTheory.Measure.haar
```
should work.
It seems like it works, but then `haarScalarFactor` can't be initialized, for example in `modularCharacterFun_eq_haarScalarFactor`.

In other lemmas that mention a measure, you will need to assume `[MeasurableSpace G] [BorelSpace G]` so that the notion of measure makes sense. But in lemmas that don't mention a measure, you won't need it.

Then I have to apply some uniqueness result about `BorelSpace`. For example now `modularCharacterFun g = haarScalarFactor (map (· * g) haar) haar` cannot be proven by `rfl`. Do you know how to do this?
You can prove it with `:= by borelize G; rfl`
you got the indentation wrong: 4 spaces in the statement, 2 spaces in the proof.

```suggestion
    (g : G) : map (· * g) μ = modularCharacterFun g • μ := by
```
instead of specifying the name by hand in all the statements, you should say in the `toAdditive` file that is should always transform `modularCharacter`  to `addModularCharacter`
In which file? `ToAdditive.Frontend`?
Yes. Look for `fixAbbreviation` there.

```suggestion
noncomputable def modularCharacter :
```

```suggestion
* `modularCharacterFun`: Define the modular character, which is
```
(and reflow the docstring)
The phrasing of the additive version should match more closely the multiplicative one (and replace `*` with `+`)
You shouldn't assume a measure here.
indentation is wrong.

pullRequest.title: feat: Modular Character of a locally compact group
